name: Wairakei Resort Taupo

reviews.text: Quite how this place has got the ratings it's got is beyond me.
reviews.title: 80's decor, 80's service, 00's prices

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Firstly don't let the 'bayview' name mislead you. There is no view of the bay to be had here. The location isn't great, so you'd expect the resort hotel needs to be something special to make up for it wouldn't you.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You'd be wrong.
reviews.title: Very rude

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in was functional (although maybe I'm getting old but I couldn't find reception at first.
reviews.title: Amateur

likes.liked: — Check-in was pleasant and room freshly decorated.

reviews.text: My room in the tallest (three storey) part of the resort, was a disappointment to say the least. The whole hotel feels like it's seen better days, and is badly in need of a refurb. My room underlined that, and wasn't so much dirty as just badly worn and torn.
reviews.title: Enjoyable time - great for families

likes.liked: — Lovely pool area, great service and facilities

reviews.text: Stayed at Bayview Wairakei Resort for 2 nights when in Taupo to watch the Ironman. Went with a friend and her daughter and had a 2 double bed room. Room was spacious and beds were comfy... not so sure about the feather pillows, though. They left me with a sore neck.
reviews.title: Would be great for a family holiday

reviews.text: Fantastic facilities at the resort. Had a wonderful massage (Thanks, Nicola!) and breakfast was good in the restaurant. My friend's daughter loved the trampoline and playground. Would've been nice to stay longer and use the pools, fitness centre and other guest facilities.
reviews.title: Nice facilities offer good value but rooms a little dated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was friendly, but rather routine. It's a big place, but they seemed very organised. A good choice if you don't need to stay right in Taupo!
reviews.title: What a place to spoil yourself

reviews.text: I enjoyed staying in a one bed villa with husband and two young children. The resort has good facilities - two swimming pools, gym, sauna, playground, tennis courts and two restaurants. The villa was spacious with newish kitchen and bathroom. Only bad thing was the carpet was filthy. And the kitchen didn't come with a kitchen knife or dishcloth. A knife was promptly organised for us but the dishcloth never came. We ate at one of the restaurants which was excellent, big servings, good value for money. The service was very mixed. We had a trainee receptionist when we arrived who had no customer service skills. But some other staff were very friendly. But not up to international standards. I recommend Wairakei for an overnight stay like we did, but there may be better options if holidaying in Taupo.
reviews.title: Great family resort, will definitely return!
ALGIM Conference
reviews.text: My husband and I had a wonderful, wonderful time at your Resorts, what a pitty we only stayed one night. We love our room 811 with its own Spa. We went for a walk around to familiarised with area and its something in the area that felt so good, fresh & relaxed. My husband enjoyed his pork for dinner & I found my pork to tough but the waitresses were great. It was 110% better than the service at breakfast at the 4+Star Hotel in Rotorua where we spent 2 hights previuosly.

I have stayed at this hotel on a couple of occassions and not had too many problems with it. However this time around I was quite dissapointed. The service was appalling, especially in the restaurant "fairways cafe"....so bad in fact that after waiting for 20 minutes to be served once seated we got up and walked across the main road to the service station to get dinner!! On a good note...the grounds are beautiful and the room decor is nice also. If you dont mind poor service...go for it!
reviews.title: Never again!!

reviews.text: We stayed here twice as a stopover on our holiday. The resort is close to busy Taupo but not within walking distance, so a car is essential. We had a room in the executive wing. Everything was tidy; everything worked the way it should. The extensive, well tended and peaceful grounds are the real attraction of this place. We loved the warm pools. We had two meals at the Fairview Cafe: tasty, well priced bistro food. The whole place was very child friendly (and there were large numbers of children of all ages around). We would stay again.
reviews.title: Quiet and spacious resort in busy tourist area

reviews.text: I stayed here with family for four days and was quite impressed with what was on offer.
reviews.title: Good Place to Relax

likes.liked: — Large park like grounds with nice facilities
likes.disliked: — You need your own transport really to stay here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Wairakei Resort is set in large park like surroundings with lots of recreational facilities on site such as tennis courts,gym and sauna,squash court,two swimmimg pools and a nine hole golf course to name a few.
reviews.title: Great resort

likes.disliked: — the fact that it poored down while we were there!

reviews.text: They have a variety of accomodation ranging from basic stand alone chalets for about NZ$100 up to NZ$700 a night suites.
reviews.title: Nice place for the quiet weekend

reviews.text: We've been trying to find a good stopover on our Auckland-Wellington drives, as we have a four-year-old, so can't drive straight through. Although I've previously though the Wairakei was a bit expensive, we'll definitely be there again - we had a bed&breakfast deal, with Eli (the child) included for free, as he's under 5. We just felt instantly relaxed and happy on arrival - a large room with two doubles, close to the spas as I'd requested, french doors opening onto an outdoor area, perfectly good buffet dinner and breakfast, and heaps of kids for Eli to run around with. Had we not fallen asleep at 8pm, we could have easily sat in the spa with a baby monitor while Eli slept, and had my husband not hurt his back, he would have definitely been in what looked like one of the best hotel gyms I've ever seen. Excellent heated swimming pools, spas that are actually open to the sky, lovely grounds - none of us wanted to leave.
reviews.title: Seem pricey, but excellent value

reviews.text: There are things you could quibble about ... the bathroom was a little dated, and yes, it's a bit out of town ... but for the price I found it excellent value, and it's definitely our new favourite stopover.
reviews.title: nice resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed a night at the resort because of a promotion and we satisfied with the rooms (2 double beds). We tried the swimming and spa pools at both locations; all of them need to be cleaned and/or filtered as there are insects floating in them. Otherwise it's a nice accommodation.
reviews.title: Can get higher marks in future

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a KING ROOM but the size of the bed seems like a Queen than a King. Room is a bit cramped. Having said that, all the facilities are very good. Staff is freindly and helpful. Can improve on the number of food items in both restaurants. Since it's raining season, resort can "lend out" umbrella to guests.
reviews.title: Out of town but nice resort with good amenities

reviews.text: This hotel was further out of town than we expected, meaning a good 10-15 min drive back into Taupo. Room was nicely refurbished and of reasonable size, if a bit pokey. The hotel has plenty of amenities, with pools, spa, gym, squash court, golf course, etc, so those wanting to bring children or stay for a few nights will be well catered for. Also had a good guest laundry which only cost $4 for a wash and dry (cheapest we saw in NZ) which was well appreciated. Didn't dine in-house.
reviews.title: Extremley enjoyable

description: Wairakei Resort Taupo is located only 5 minutes north of Taupo town centre, offering superb hotel and villa accommodation in Taupo with excellent indoor & outdoor leisure facilities and dining options, as well as a being a purpose built Taupo conference venue. All situated in a stunning historic setting, close to Taupo’s many activities and attractions.
